title: Govt says 118 medical colleges opened in India in past two years: Which state got the most?
content: The union government has set up 118 medical colleges in the country in the last two years. The Union health ministry informed the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday, during the ongoing Winter session of Parliament. Responding to a question by MP Anupriya Patel, the ministry shared the details in a written reply, stating that 74 medical colleges were approved in AY 2024–25 and 44 in AY 2025–26, based on National Medical Commission (NMC) approvals. The reply also included the state-wise distribution of these colleges. Uttar Pradesh saw the highest number of new colleges across the two years, followed by Maharashtra and Rajasthan. The reply further stated that the expansion of medical infrastructure is part of the government’s ongoing effort to increase the availability of medical education and healthcare services. (Source: Rajya Sabha UNSTARRED QUESTION NO. 268, Answered on December 2, 2025) In a separate written reply, Union Health Minister J P Nadda informed the House that India’s doctor-population ratio is currently estimated at 1:811, assuming that 80 per cent of registered practitioners in both allopathic and AYUSH systems are available. India has 13,88,185 registered allopathic doctors and 7,51,768 AYUSH practitioners. Nadda added that the number of medical colleges has risen from 387 to 818 since 2014, while UG seats have increased from 51,348 to 1,28,875 and PG seats from 31,185 to 82,059. The government also detailed the seat additions over the last two years. According to the response, 8,641 undergraduate seats were added in AY 2024–25 and 11,732 UG seats in AY 2025–26. Postgraduate capacity saw the addition of 4,188 PG seats in AY 2024–25 and 3,393 PG seats in AY 2025–26. Looking ahead, the government outlined its future expansion plan. On September 24, the Union Cabinet approved Phase-III of the Centrally Sponsored Scheme for strengthening and upgrading state and central government medical colleges and standalone PG institutes. This phase, which will run from 2025-26

title: ‘Thank God school reopened, but…’: Routine returns to Delhi schools as classes go offline amid poor AQI
content: Offline classes for students up to Class 5 resumed this week across Delhi-NCR after the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) lifted Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) Stage-3 restrictions. The move came after a marginal improvement in Delhi’s air quality, though the AQI has continued to oscillate between the “poor” and “very poor” categories. Parents and students said the reopening has brought back routine but not relief. Many expressed unease about children commuting and sitting in classrooms amid what they describe as “visible pollution”. “The AQI may have improved on paper, but the air still smells toxic. My son starts coughing the moment he steps out. I’m not fully convinced schools should have reopened so quickly,” said Mamta Agrawal, a parent from Noida. Others felt academic continuity needed priority. “Children can’t keep shifting between online and offline modes. My daughter’s focus breaks every time this happens,” said Yogendra Yadav, a parent from East Delhi . Teachers voiced concerns about classroom ventilation and preparedness. “Not all schools have air purifiers, and younger students often either forget masks or are not comfortable using them. We worry about prolonged exposure,” said Sumit Sharma, a government school teacher in North Delhi. “It’s definitely challenging for us as teachers. Online classes demand that we constantly work to keep students focused on a screen, and that itself is tiring. Now that offline classes are resuming, we have to divide our attention between students sitting in front of us and those who may still be joining remotely. Managing both formats together affects the pace of teaching, and it becomes difficult to ensure every child is engaged and learning equally,” said the Delhi government school teacher. A working mother from Delhi, Ginni Bhandari, echoed the sentiment. “I was sending my daughter (who is in Class 5) to school because being a working parent, it was difficult for me to handle everything. And it’s quite a

title: SBI SO Registrations 2025 commence at sbi.bank.in; 996 posts in offer
content: SBI SO Recruitment 2025 Registration: The State Bank of India ( SBI ) has issued the SBI Specialist Officer (SO) Recruitment 2025 notification. Applications are currently underway, and candidates can apply until December 23. In order to apply, eligible candidates are required to register on the recruitment portal of SBI at sbi.bank.in/careers . The Specialist Officer roles under the SBI SO 2025 recruitment will be filled on a five-year contractual appointment. After the completion of this period, the bank may extend the contract for up to four additional years, depending on performance and any renewal conditions laid down by SBI. The available positions are of VP Wealth, AVP Wealth, and Customer Relations Executive, with a total of 996 posts across these. Step 1: Visit the SBI recruitment portal at sbi.bank.in Step 2: Find and read the SBI SO Recruitment 2025 notification to understand eligibility and vacancy distribution Step 3: Register on the portal by entering personal details to generate login credentials Step 4: Complete the application form by providing educational and professional information Step 5: Upload the required documents, pay the applicable fee, and submit the form before December 23, 2025 The recruitment process for SBI Specialist Officers in 2025 consists of two stages. First, applicants will be shortlisted based on the information they provide, including their academic background, relevant work experience and overall suitability for the post. Candidates who clear this stage will be invited for a personal interview, during which their professional competence, subject knowledge and role fit will be evaluated. title: AIIMS INI SS 2025 Results Out: How to check at aiimsexams.ac.in
content: AIIMS INI SS 2025 Results Out: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has announced the results of the Institute of National Importance Super-Speciality (INI-SS) Entrance Test for the January 2026 session. Candidates who sat for the exam on November 22, 2025, can view the roll number–wise list of provisionally qualified candidates on the official AIIMS examination portal–aiimsexams.ac.in. As per the notification, the results include candidates who have cleared Stage I of the INI-SS examination. These candidates are eligible to seek admission to DM/MCh programmes at AIIMS New Delhi , established AIIMS campuses, Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (JIPMER) Puducherry , Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research (PGIMER) Chandigarh , National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (NIMHANS) Bengaluru , and Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology (SCTIMST) Trivandrum. AIIMS has issued the results in PDF format, which candidates can download directly without requiring login credentials. The document provides details, including each candidate’s roll number, the category under which they applied, and their qualification status. Candidates are advised to carefully verify this information to confirm their eligibility for the next stage of admission. Following the announcement of the results, AIIMS Delhi will oversee the counselling process for qualified candidates. Those eligible must first register for counselling and then submit their preferences for the available super-speciality seats. Final seat allotment will be determined based on the merit list and the choices entered by candidates. For the January 2026 academic session, AIIMS will hold three rounds of counselling to allocate super-speciality seats across leading institutions, including AIIMS, PGIMER, NIMHANS, and SCTIMST. title: CBSE Board Exams 2025: Practical exams marks to be uploaded on same-day; check detailed SOPs here
content: CBSE Practical Exams 2025 SOPs issued: The Central Board of Secondary Education ( CBSE ) has released a detailed set of guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for the conduct of practical examinations, project work and internal assessments for Classes 10 and 12 for the 2025–26 academic session. The board has reminded schools that adherence to instructions is mandatory, and no request for changes in uploaded marks will be entertained, according to the CBSE. In its notice, schools have also been instructed to complete assessments within the prescribed schedule, as CBSE will be conducting four examinations this year and timelines will be limited for any extensions. Additionally, schools have been asked ensure that correct marks are uploaded after verifying the maximum marks allotted for each subject. The board has clarified that marks once uploaded cannot be changed later. CBSE has stated that any student participating in a national or international sports event whose practical exams clash with the event may be accommodated. The notice states that “the school may reschedule the practicals within the overall CBSE schedule” but that no extra time beyond the notified window will be permitted, according to the CBSE. CBSE has reiterated that all practical examinations, project work and internal assessments must align with guidelines available on the academic branch website. Schools and examiners must familiarise themselves with the maximum marks distribution as mentioned in the curriculum document and the circular issued on November 17, 2025. The practical exam period for regular schools will be from January 1 to February 14, 2026 . Winter-bound schools will conduct exams from November 6 to December 6, 2025, as earlier communicated by the CBSE. For Class 10, the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has listed a set of assessment-related instructions that schools must follow during the 2025–26 practical and internal evaluation cycle. title: APTET 2025 Admit Cards (Soon): When and where to download hall tickets
content: The Department of School Education, Government of Andhra Pradesh, will issue the AP TET 2025 hall ticket starting December 3. Candidates can download their APTET admit card from the official website, aptet.apcfss.in, by entering their candidate ID and date of birth. According to the schedule, the AP TET examination will begin on December 10, 2025, in computer-based test (CBT) mode, conducted in two shifts daily. All candidates must carry a printed copy of their hall ticket along with a valid photo ID proof to the exam centre. After downloading, candidates should carefully verify the details mentioned on the hall ticket. Any discrepancies or errors must be promptly reported to the exam conducting authority for correction. Candidates can follow these steps to download their AP TET hall tickets 2025 online. Step 1: Visit the official website – aptet.apcfss.in. Step 2: Log in using credentials like ID, mobile Number or Aadhar number along with date of birth in the space provided. Step 3: Click on the submit to proceed. Step 4: Download and take a printout of the AP TET 2025 hall ticket for future use. The AP TET 2025 admit card contains all the essential information related to the examination, including details of the exam centre, schedule, and candidate particulars. It mentions the exam name, the candidate’s name, the father’s and mother’s names, registration number, and roll number. In addition, it specifies the category, gender, and date of birth of the applicant, along with the date of the AP TET 2025 exam, exam time and shift, and the name and address of the allotted exam centre. The hall ticket also provides important exam day instructions that candidates must follow to ensure the smooth conduct of the test. The AP TET examination, conducted once every year by the Department of School Education, Andhra Pradesh, is designed to assess the eligibility of candidates for teaching positions in the state’s primary and upper primary schools. title: IIM Raipur announces new Business Accelerator programme with 100% fee sponsorship, applications underway
content: Indian Institute of Management Raipur (IIM Raipur) has partnered with the National SC-ST Hub (NSSH) of the Ministry of MSME, Government of India, to launch a comprehensive Business Accelerator programme. Applications for the Business Accelerator programme are open until December 15, 2025, with the programme set to begin on January 17, 2026. Also Read | CAT exam application fees rise 31% since 2021 The initiative aims to empower existing and aspiring SC/ST entrepreneurs, start-ups, and small business owners by equipping them with the skills, knowledge, and support essential for scaling their ventures. The new programme is designed to help participants move beyond survival and achieve sustainable, scalable growth. The programme follows a blended learning model that combines immersive on-campus sessions at IIM Raipur with engaging live online classes. It also offers 72 hours of structured instruction and 18 hours of dedicated mentoring by IIM Raipur faculty, industry leaders, and seasoned practitioners, ensuring a transformative and growth-driven learning experience for every participant. The accelerator programme is built to help participants sharpen their business models, identify high-potential markets, strengthen financial decision-making, and leverage digital tools for operational efficiency. Through concept sessions, case discussions rooted in MSME realities, hands-on exercises, and one-on-one mentoring clinics, entrepreneurs will work directly on their business challenges and develop clear 90–180 day action roadmaps. This programme, an IIM Raipur statement says, also provides participants with opportunities to explore new markets, understand government procurement processes, and build valuable networks with peers, mentors, and ecosystem partners who can support their entrepreneurial journey. title: IBPS PO Mains Merit List Out 2025: How to check at ibps.in; what next?
content: IBPS PO Mains Merit List Out 2025: The Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) has released the IBPS PO Mains Result 2025 on its official portal, ibps.in. Candidates who took the Probationary Officer (PO) Mains Examination on October 12, 2025, can view their result status for the CRP-PO/MT-XV recruitment cycle. In addition to the results, IBPS has provided both section-wise and overall scores, enabling candidates to evaluate their performance comprehensively. Those who qualify in the mains will proceed to the group discussion and interview round, which serves as the final stage of the selection process. Last year, IBPS PO Mains exam was held on November 30, and the result was declared on January 31. Step 1: Visit the official website – ibps.in Step 2: Click on the IBPS PO prelims result link on the homepage Step 3: On the next login page, enter the application number or roll number and date of birth or password Step 4: Submit and download the IBPS PO mains result 2025 The IBPS PO Mains scorecard will be available for download until December 7, 2025. Candidates are advised to secure a copy within this period, as the scorecard will be required during the group discussion and interview rounds of the recruitment process. Each candidate will be required to obtain a minimum score in each test of the online main examination and also a minimum total score to be considered to be shortlisted for the personality test and interview. Depending on the number of vacancies available, cut-offs will be decided, and candidates will be shortlisted for an interview. Candidates who qualified in the Mains examination will be invited for a personal interview conducted by IBPS in collaboration with participating banks. During the interview, candidates will be evaluated on key parameters such as: –Banking awareness –Communication skills –Personality and confidence –Situational understanding The interview carries a total of 100 marks. title: Karnataka HC restricts fresh recruitment under state’s enhanced SC/ST quota law
content: In a setback to the state government, the Karnataka High Court has barred it from issuing any fresh recruitment notifications in an Act which had raised quotas for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes. The restriction on recruitment under the Karnataka Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Scheduled Tribes (STs) (Reservation of Seats in Education Institutions and Appointments of Posts and Services under the State) Act, 2022, will remain until further orders. However, the HC bench allowed the government to continue recruitment processes already notified before November 19, 2025, even if they follow the increased reservation percentages. The court also clarified that all appointments made through these ongoing recruitments will be subject to the final outcome of the petitions challenging the law. The division bench of Chief Justice Vibhu Bakhru and Justice C M Poonacha issued the interim order on November 27 while hearing two PILs filed by Mahendra Kumar Mitra of Raichur and Mahesh of Bengaluru . The petitions question the constitutional validity of the 2022 Act, particularly the hike in SC/ST reservation, from 15 per cent to 17 per cent for SCs and from 3 per cent to 7 per cent for STs. Other Backward Classes (OBCs) reservation continues to remain at 32 per cent, which takes over all reservations in the state to 56 per cent. The Bench directed that all appointment or promotion orders issued under the Act must explicitly state that they are provisional and contingent on the court’s final judgment, preventing candidates from claiming equity if the enhanced quotas are struck down. The court further stated that this interim permission to continue ongoing recruitments will not override any specific interim or final orders already passed by courts or tribunals in related matters. The government had earlier argued that halting ongoing recruitments would disrupt administrative functioning due to manpower shortages. title: Jammu and Kashmir designates JKBOSE as standards authority for the UT
content: The Jammu and Kashmir government on Monday designated the Board of School Education as the State School Standards Authority for the Union territory, in accordance with the provisions of the National Education Policy 2020. An order issued by the Under Secretary in the School Education Department, Thanaji Bhat, said the decision is aimed at ensuring transparent, independent and effective regulation of schools across Jammu and Kashmir. “In exercise of the powers vested in the School Education Department, the J-K Board of School Education ( JKBOSE ) is hereby designated as the State School Standards Authority (SSSA) for the Union territory, in accordance with the provisions and mandates of the National Education Policy ( NEP ) 2020,” the order said. As mandated under NEP-2020 , the SSSA will oversee separation of regulatory, academic, examination and administrative functions, and will be entrusted with responsibilities related to standard setting, monitoring and ensuring compliance with norms concerning safety, infrastructure, teacher qualifications, governance and financial probity. The order also takes note of the recommendation of PARAKH – the national assessment centre under NCERT – which suggests that state examination boards be designated as SSSAs to ensure equivalence of standards across different school boards. Several boards, including the CBSE at the national level, and the boards of Himachal Pradesh and Mizoram, have already been notified as SSSAs by the respective governments. JKBOSE , established under the Jammu and Kashmir Board of School Education Act, 1975, is the statutory body responsible for curriculum development, examinations and affiliation of schools in the UT, and possesses the required infrastructure, systems and expertise to discharge the regulatory functions of the authority. title: SSC GD Constable 2026: Apply for 25,487 vacancies at ssc.gov.in; exam in Feb- April
content: SSC GD Constable 2026 Recruitment: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has released the notification for Constable (General Duty) recruitment in CAPFs, SSF, and Rifleman (GD) in Assam Rifles for the 2026 examination cycle. The Commission has also started the registration process at the official website — ssc.gov.in. The online application process commenced on December 1, 2025, and will remain open until December 31, 2025, till 11 pm. Candidates can pay the examination fee online until January 1, 2026. Application starts on: December 1 Application ends on: December 31 Last date to pay the fee: January 1 Application correction window: January 8 to 10, 2026 Tentative Schedule of Computer-Based Examination – Feb- April, 2026 The recruitment drive offers 25,487 vacancies across multiple forces, including the Border Security Force (BSF), Central Industrial Security Force (CISF), Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF), Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB), Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP), Assam Rifles, and the Secretariat Security Force (SSF). Of the total posts, 23,467 are designated for male candidates and 2,020 for female candidates. SSC has noted that these figures are provisional and may be revised depending on the requirements of the participating forces. Candidates applying for SSC GD recruitment must be citizens of India. Since vacancies in CAPFs and Assam Rifles are allocated on a State/UT/area-wise basis, applicants are required to submit a domicile certificate or Permanent Residence Certificate (PRC) corresponding to their state or Union Territory of residence. For age eligibility, the crucial date for reckoning is January 1, 2026, in line with the provisions of DoP&T OM No. 14017/70/87-Estt. ( RR ) dated July 14, 1988. Accordingly, candidates must be between 18 and 23 years of age as on January 1, 2026—that is, born not earlier than January 2, 2003 and not later than January 1, 2008. title: JEE Main, NEET: Govt school students in Delhi to get free coaching
content: The Delhi Government will be offering free professional coaching to 2,200 meritorious government school students for JEE , NEET , CLAT , CA and CUET under the Mahamana Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya Vidya Shakti Mission, Education Minister Ashish Sood has announced. The mission aims to empower students’ aspirations, ensure emotional well-being and build future-ready schools across the capital, an official statement said on Monday. This scheme, which was announced in the budget , has an allocation of Rs 21 crore. It reserves 50 seats per course for female students in JEE, NEET, CLAT, and CA Foundation, while CUET-UG will offer 1,000 seats, with 150 reserved for girls. Coaching will be provided through empanelled institutions, including Aakash Institute, Narayana Academy, KD Campus and Ravindra Institute, it said. Students will receive classroom coaching, live sessions, study material and test preparation support after school hours and on weekends. Calling it a turning point in Delhi ’s public education, Sood said 62,000 students appeared for the CET-2025 conducted on October 30. Counselling has concluded, and physical classes commenced on November 26, 2025. Reiterating the importance of emotionally safe learning environments, the minister said, education is not just about marks; it is about mental wellness, dignity and humanity. He further emphasised that the government is developing AI-enabled classrooms and human-centred education systems to ensure truly equal opportunities for every child. Highlighting the mission’s meritocratic spirit, Sood said the Vidya Shakti Mission is a movement to empower talent, protect mental wellness and unlock Delhi’s academic potential at the grassroots. title: Lok Sabha clears resolution to elect 2 members to IISc Bengaluru Council
content: The Lok Sabha on Monday approved a government resolution enabling the election of two of its members to the Council of the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru . Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan introduced the motion, seeking the election of two Lok Sabha representatives to the governing body of IISc — India’s premier institution for advanced scientific research and education. The resolution over IISc was carried through by a voice vote. The IISc Council serves as the institute’s apex decision-making authority, guiding its administration and long-term strategy. Its mandate includes strengthening infrastructure, enhancing research capabilities, and fostering global collaborations. The Council’s composition reflects a broad spectrum of stakeholders, with nominees from the Central and Karnataka governments, Tata Trusts, the University Grants Commission (UGC), the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), the Association of Indian Universities, as well as members of both the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha . Recently, one of the members of the IISc council, the Tata Trust, has announced an important partnership to establish the Tata IISc Medical School on the IISc campus in Bengaluru . The collaboration aims to revolutionise healthcare education and research in India by integrating clinical practice with advancements in science and engineering. As part of the agreement, the Tata Group will contribute Rs 500 crore to support the establishment of the medical school, which is envisioned as a centre of excellence in healthcare. The partnership was formalised through a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed on Monday. The Tata IISc Medical School will focus on key medical specialities, including oncology, cardiology, neurology, nephrology, diabetes and metabolic disorders, infectious diseases, integrative medicine, and public health. It will offer integrated MD-PhD and dual-degree programmes to train a new generation of physician-scientists and medic

title: IIT Scholarships: Want to study at IIT-Roorkee? Know about these scholarships
content: The Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee (IIT Roorkee) awards scholarships annually to deserving students. These are offered either as tuition fee concessions or direct transfers to students’ bank accounts. Key scholarships include Merit-cum-Means, James Thomason, INSPIRE SHE, Dr S.K. Goel, and Kusum Goel for disadvantaged engineering students, as well as the Sharman Foundation. IIT Roorkee offers undergraduate programs across 10 disciplines in engineering and architecture, along with postgraduate programmes in 55 fields spanning engineering, applied sciences, architecture, and planning. Also Read | IIT Kharagpur Scholarships | IIT-Hyderabad Scholarships The Merit Cum Means (MCM) scholarship at IIT Roorkee provides financial support to undergraduate and M.Sc. students. Eligible UG students receive at least Rs 1,000 per month for 10 months along with a refund of the remaining tuition fee, while M.Sc. students receive Rs 1,000 per month for 10 months. The scholarship is available only for the normal duration of the programme, and for dual degree courses, it is limited to the first four years. Also Read | IIT Mandi Scholarships It is awarded to up to 25 per cent of the actual strength of each class. To qualify, applicants must belong to the General, General (EWS), or OBC category, be enrolled in BTech, BArch, IDD, IMT, IMS, BS-MS (via JEE Advanced), or MSc (via JAM) programs, and have a parental or guardian income not exceeding Rs 5 lakh in the current assessment year. Students must maintain a CGPA and YGPA of 7.00 or above, clear all registered courses, and have no record of indiscipline or use of unfair means. Fresh entrants are exempt from the CGPA and course clearance requirements. Also Read | IIT Bombay Scholarships The James Thomason (JT) Scholarship at IIT Roorkee is awarded to students admitted through JEE (Advanced) into BTech., B.Arch., Integrated Dual Degree (IDD), Integrated Master of Technology (IMT), Integrated Master of Science (IMS), and BS-MS program

title: UPPSC PCS 2025 prelims result out, link to download here
content: UPPSC PCS Prelims Result 2025: The Uttar Pradesh Public Service Commission (UPPSC) has released the UPPSC PCS 2025 prelims result. The Commission has made the UPPSC PCS 2025 prelims result link available at uppsc.up.nic.in. As many as 11,727 candidates will now appear in the next stage of recruitment. The Commission had earlier released the answer keys on October 18 and candidates were able to raise objections against the answer key. Based on the objections received on the UPPSC PCS provisional answer key, the Commission prepared the final answer key and announced the UPPSC prelims result 2025. Step 1: Visit the official website of UPPSC — uppsc.up.nic.in. Step 2: Click on the designated UPPSC PCS answer key 2025 link available on the home page Step 3: Check and download the result The UPPSC PCS prelims exam was held on October 12. The UPPSC prelims exam was conducted in two shifts — first from 9.30 am to 11.30 am and second between 2.30 pm and 4.30 pm at 75 districts of the state. The Uttar Pradesh Public Service Commission exam is a state-level examination to select applicants for various positions within the state government of Uttar Pradesh. The examination is divided into three parts — the preliminary exam, the mains exam, and the interview. According to reports, out of over 6.26 lakh registered candidates, of which 2.65 lakh appeared for the exam. In Prayagraj, out of 28,368 registered candidates at 67 centres, only 14,339 (50.54%) appeared, while 14,029 (49.46%) were absent. Candidates who qualify the Mains exam will be shortlisted for the Interview round. The UPPSC will announce further updates, including the Mains exam dates and admit card release schedule, on its official website in due course. title: ‘We’ll engage with the government, but stay true to our mission’: University of Arizona president on rejecting Trump’s higher-ed compact
content: Seven out of nine universities that the White House initially offered a “compact” granting preferential federal funding in exchange for aligning with President Donald Trump’s policy priorities have now declined to sign it. The University of Arizona became the latest institution to reject the proposal, joining Brown University, Dartmouth College, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) , the University of Pennsylvania, the University of Southern California, and the University of Virginia. The remaining two institutions, Vanderbilt University and the University of Texas at Austin, have not yet publicly declined. The Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education, sent to the nine universities on October 1, outlines ten reform areas that institutions would need to comply with to access priority federal funding. The proposed measures include banning the consideration of race and sex in admissions, capping the proportion of international students, abolishing student groups that “punish or belittle conservative ideas,” and defining gender based strictly on “reproductive function and biological processes.” Suresh Garimella, The President of the University of Arizona spoke to The Indian Express over email about the university’s decision, the meaning of academic freedom in 2025, and the landscape for international students, particularly from India. Q: What does ‘academic freedom’ mean to you in the present political climate? At the University of Arizona, we regard academic freedom as foundational to our mission. It protects the right to pursue knowledge and engage in civil debate, even on difficult subjects, while ensuring that learning and respectful dialogue can flourish. We do not allow intimidation, disruption, or vandalism that undermines speech or participation in campus life. Consistent with our Statement of Principles, the university does not take positions on political or social issues beyond those affecting our teaching, research, or operations. We als

title: Today News Headlines for School Assembly, December 2, 2025: Women’s hockey coach Harendra Singh quits
content: Today News Headlines for School Assembly, December 02, 2025: Here are the news headlines for school assembly on December 2, 2025. Major updates include heightened vigilance along the Jammu border as Pakistan reportedly rebuilds terror launchpads and a directive requiring smartphones to preinstall the Sanchar Saathi app. International developments feature Trump’s envoy engaging in exploratory talks with Putin and Russia criticising NATO’s remarks on pre-emptive strikes. Sports news highlights the New Zealand–West Indies first Test. Southern Command conducts successful long-range precision launch of BrahMos missile The BSF said that Pakistan has rebuilt terror launchpads along the Jammu frontier , noting increased activity across the border and enhanced surveillance under Operation Sindoor. Cold wave conditions are likely to prevail in the capital. IMD issues yellow alert in Delhi . title: IIT Roorkee Placements 2025: 436 students secure offers on day one; 8 international, 428 in domestic
content: IIT Roorkee has started its placement process for the 2025–26 academic year. According to an official statement, students and recruiters participated actively from the opening slot, marking the beginning of the institute’s annual recruitment cycle. The institute has collaborated with organisations across sectors, with roles concentrated in artificial intelligence, data analytics, semiconductor technology, sustainability and core engineering domains. The partnerships, according to the official statement, have been structured to reflect current industry requirements and student specialisations. At the close of the 1.1 slot on Day 1, IIT Roorkee recorded 8 international offers and 428 domestic offers. More offers are expected as the remaining Day 1 sessions progress. The institute noted that the early numbers indicate an improvement over the same period last year. Recruiters on campus Companies participating in this phase include Amazon, American Express, Bajaj Auto , BEL, BPCL, D. E. Shaw, Databricks, Flipkart, Google, HPCL, Mastercard, Meesho, Microsoft, NatWest Group, NVIDIA, Oracle, Qualcomm, SAP Labs, SLB Engineering & Software, Sprinklr, Squarepoint Capital, Texas Instruments and others. The institute expects the momentum to continue through subsequent slots, with more organisations scheduled to conduct processes over the next several days.  During a recent Netflix show, Dining With The Kapoors, Kareena Kapoor brushed aside the question about Kapoor family members calling paparazzi for spottings. However, this proved wrong when a video recently went viral, in which frustrated photographers can be seen questioning Ranbir Kapoor’s team for stopping them from clicking photos of the star despite the actor's team called them to click him.

title: Jamia Millia researcher secures Commonwealth Split-site scholarship; what the programme offers, eligibility
content: Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) research scholar Nitesh Dogne has been selected for the Commonwealth Split-site Scholarship for the academic year 2025-26. Dogne is pursuing his PhD on “Indigenous Knowledge System of Tribal Circularity” under the Department of Planning and the Department of Architecture at JMI. According to an official statement, Dogne will spend one year at the University of Bath as part of the award. His proposal was also accepted by University College London, the University of Edinburgh, the University of Glasgow, and Newcastle University for consideration under the scholarship scheme. The research examines the Bhil tribe’s traditional use of water, energy, biomass, and waste in circular, community-driven systems. Faculty supervisors stated that these practices offer insights for targets related to clean water, clean energy and climate action. The study also focuses on documenting practices that are declining due to urban expansion, and aims to contribute to broader work on the Indian Knowledge System. The Commonwealth Split-site Scholarship is administered by the Commonwealth Scholarship Commission (CSC), United Kingdom. According to an official statement, the programme supports PhD scholars registered at universities in Commonwealth countries so they can conduct part of their doctoral research at a UK institution. The scholarship is fully funded and is offered to a limited number of scholars each year. CSC data shows that in 2024, only 57 scholars from 40 countries were selected across all disciplines. The award covers airfare, tuition fees, living expenses and research support for the period spent in the UK. As per CSC guidelines, the Split-site Scholarship is meant for PhD students who have already initiated their research in their home universities. Applicants must demonstrate the relevance of their work to development priorities and show how joint supervision between UK and home institutions will advance their research. title: IGNOU re-registration for January 2026 ODL, online courses begins at ignou.ac.in
content: Indira Gandhi National Open University ( IGNOU ) has opened the re-registration window for the January 2026 academic session. The portal went live on December 1, 2025, for all learners enrolled in Open and Distance Learning (ODL) and online programmes. Students can now submit their forms on the official website, ignou.ac.in. The last date to complete the process is January 15, 2026. Students can log in to update their details, choose courses, and pay the required fee for the next semester or year. The university has stated that re-registration is mandatory for all existing learners who wish to continue their programmes in the upcoming cycle. According to an official statement, incorrect course selection could lead to delays in the academic schedule. IGNOU has asked students to make payments only through the approved online modes—debit or credit cards, net banking, or UPI. In case a payment is delayed, learners are advised to wait before retrying. If a double payment occurs, one amount will be refunded automatically. The re-registration form is available on the official portal at ignou.samarth.edu.in. Students can complete the process through the following steps: Step 1: Visit ignou.ac.in and open the re-registration link under “Register Online.” Step 2: Read all instructions on the portal. Step 3: Log in using the required credentials and fill in personal details and selected courses. Step 4: Upload documents, if required, and make the fee payment. Step 5: Review the form, submit it, and download the confirmation page and receipt. The university has advised students not to wait until the last day, as heavy traffic on the portal may cause technical issues. After submitting the form, learners should save the confirmation page and payment receipt for future reference. Students registered under the International Division can also apply online using the payment options available in their region. They are required to follow the same steps as domestic learners. title: Here’s why record 37 lakh applicants have appeared in China’s civil service exam
content: China’s civil service exam saw a record 3.7 million candidates, showing how competition for government jobs is rising as the country faces high unemployment and an uncertain job market. The exam, which selects candidates for central government roles and their branches, saw roughly 98 applicants competing for every available post, according to official data. Authorities also disclosed that approximately 70 per cent of the vacancies are earmarked for fresh college graduates, according to a report of the China Internet Information Center. The sweeping changes this year stem from a major policy shift: the general age cap for aspirants has been raised from 35 to 38 years, while fresh graduates holding master’s or doctoral degrees can now sit for the exam up to age 43, a considerable increase from prior limits (which were 35 and 40, respectively). Beijing has framed the reforms as part of efforts to adjust to shifting demographic realities, including a shrinking working-age population and an increasing trend of prolonged education and delayed workforce entry. Analysts suggest the revised age limits also help counter pervasive “ageism” in the job market and harness the skills of slightly older or more experienced candidates for public service. Read | ‘We’ll engage with the government, but stay true to our mission’: University of Arizona president on rejecting Trump’s higher-ed compact But the surge in applicants and stiff competition also reflects broader socioeconomic pressures. Many in China, according to a Guardian report , appear to be turning away from unstable private-sector jobs in favour of government roles that still promise the much-coveted “iron-rice-bowl” of lifetime job security, even if pay is lower and growth slower. For context, the 2026 recruitment drive aims to fill about 38,100 civil-service posts across central government institutions and their subordinate agencies. title: CAT exam application fees rise 31% since 2021: Asaduddin Owaisi
content: The application fees for the Common Admission Test (CAT) have risen by 31 per cent since 2021. On the opening day of the Winter Session of Parliament, Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi raised a question to the Ministry of Education regarding the steep hike in CAT application fees. Conducted by the Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) , the exam serves as a gateway for students aspiring to pursue MBA programmes. CAT 2025 Exam Paper Analysis Owaisi informed the Lok Sabha that, as compared to CAT 2024 , there has been an approximate increase of 5 per cent in the application fee of CAT 2025 . This year’s exam was conducted on November 30, in three slots and was hosted by IIM Kozhikode . For CAT 2025, the application fee is Rs 2,600 for General and OBC candidates, and Rs 1,300 for SC, ST, and PwBD applicants. In comparison, the fee in 2021 was Rs 2,200 for General/OBC and Rs 1,100 for SC, ST, and PwBD categories. CAT 2025 Live Updates The Minister of State in the Ministry of Education, Dr Sukanta Majumdar, replied to Owaisi’s question that the Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) are governed under the Indian Institutes of Management Act, 2017, and are empowered to determine, specify, and receive payments of fees and other charges. Also Read | India sees 26% surge in MBA applications as UK, Canada programmes report declines amid visa uncertainty “The Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) are governed under the Indian Institutes of Management Act, 2017, as amended from time to time. Under the Act, the IIMs are empowered to determine, specify and receive payments of fees and other charges,” said MoS Dr Sukanta Majumdar. The Minister elaborated on how the application fees are used by the conducting IIM to successfully conduct the CAT exam. “The CAT application fee is decided every year to cover the administrative, logistical, and operational costs involved in conducting the exam in that year on a national scale,” he said, adding that the CAT fee is non-refundable as the lo

title: NITK-Surathkal holds ring presentation ceremony for 2020, 2021 batches; over 1700 students take part
content: The National Institute of Technology Karnataka (NIT-K), Surathkal conducted its Ring Presentation Ceremony on 29 November 2025 at the institute campus. The event honoured graduates from the 2020 and 2021 batches, who had completed their programmes during the COVID-19 pandemic. A total of 1,731 students received their silver rings, either in person or through home delivery, according to an official statement. After sharp slump in 2023-24, IIT placements improve, still below 2021-22 mark The ceremony marked the formal recognition of 881 students from the 2020 batch and 850 from the 2021 batch. The 2020 cohort included 555 B.Tech, 247 M.Tech, 10 MBA, 10 MCA, 23 M.Sc. and 36 Ph.D. graduates, while the 2021 cohort comprised 475 B.Tech, 253 M.Tech, 17 MBA, 57 MCA, 12 M.Sc. and 36 Ph.D. graduates. Each student was presented with a silver ring engraved with the NI-K emblem and their year of graduation. The tradition, initiated over fifty years ago by Prof AS Adke, continues to be a distinctive feature of NIT -K and is viewed as a symbol of lasting connection between the institute and its alumni. Shri Niranjan Mahabalappa, President of the NITK Alumni Association, participated as Guest of Honour. The event was presided over by Prof B Ravi, Director of NIT-K, and saw the presence of faculty, staff, and students, along with institute leadership including Prof Govinda Raj Mandela, Dean of Students Welfare, and Prof Prasanna Belur D, Dean of Alumni and Corporate Relations. title: IIT-Bombay, Great Learning launch certificate course in Leadership with AI
content: The I ndian Institute of Technology, Bombay, and Great Learning have introduced a certificate course on Leadership in Artificial Intelligence. This four-month online certificate is scheduled to start in January 2026, with registrations now open. Designed and delivered by IIT Bombay faculty, the certificate will enable participants to envision, lead, and scale AI initiatives effectively. The application will close on December 5. As mentioned in the press release, the course will begin with core modules on AI-ready leadership, Generative AI and agents, AI-led business strategy, and building a responsible AI-first organisation. The Certificate in Leadership with AI is ideal for mid to senior professionals, business leaders, and entrepreneurs looking to develop AI-driven strategies and lead transformation within their organisations. The course fee is Rs 2 lakh, plus GST. Candidates holding a Bachelor’s degree in any discipline from a recognised university with a minimum aggregate of 50 per cent or equivalent CGPA, plus a work experience of 3 years, are eligible to register in this course. In the final module, participants choose an industry-specific specialisation and go through sector-relevant case studies, gaining practical insights relevant to their field. Upon successful completion, learners will be awarded a Certificate of Completion from IIT Bombay. For more information, visit mygreatlearning.com/iit-bombay-certificate-leadership-with-ai Those interested will go through three stages for the selection process: application, interview process, and offer of registration. In the last stage of the process, selected candidates will get an offer letter and must pay the fee to confirm registration. The IIT Bombay Certificate in Leadership with AI covers foundations for AI-ready leadership, including ACID technologies, data modernisation, AI/ML/DL applications, and AI economics. It explores generative AI and agents for business transformation, focusing on prompt engineering

title: UP Board Class 10th, 12th Exams: List of centres for annual exams
content: UPMSP Class 10th, 12th Exams 2026: The Uttar Pradesh Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad (UPMSP) has released the list of 7,448 designated exam centres for the UP Board Class 10 and 12 examinations in 2026 . Students who have registered for the UP Board annual examinations for 2026 can raise objections to the exam centre list until December 4. All objections will be reviewed by December 11, after which the final approved list will be published on the official website, upmsp.edu.in. The Uttar Pradesh Board has reduced the number of exam centres from 7,657 to 7,448 compared to last year. In the 2023–24 UP Board examinations, a total of 8,265 centres were allotted. #upboardpryj #BoardExams2026 pic.twitter.com/sgEAlFcfeA — Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad (@upboardpryj) November 30, 2025  The district school inspector will review the objections received, address them promptly, and forward the updated list with the approval and recommendation of the District Centre Determination Committee. The updated timetable includes changes to key subjects, mainly Hindi and Sanskrit, with modifications in both exam dates and timings. Candidates can check the revised schedule on the official X handle of the UP Madhyamik Shiksha Parishad . According to the revised notice, the UP Board Class 10 Hindi and Primary Hindi examinations will now be held on February 18, 2026 , in the morning shift from 8:30 am to 11:45 am. Similarly, the Class 12 Hindi and General Hindi papers are rescheduled for the same day but in the afternoon shift from 2:00 pm to 5:15 pm. The Class 12 Sanskrit paper, originally planned earlier in March, will now be conducted on March 12, 2026, during the same afternoon slot. title: SSC JE Admit Card 2025: How to download call letters for Dec 3 exam?
content: SSC JE Admit Card 2025: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has released the admit cards for the Junior Engineer (JE) 2025 examination. The Staff Selection Commission will conduct Paper 1 of SSC JE 2025 from December 3 to December 6, 2025. The exam is being held for Junior Engineer posts in Civil, Mechanical and Electrical disciplines. The recruitment process aims to fill 1,731 Junior Engineer vacancies across departments. Candidates will be able to download from the OTR portal available on the official website of the commission at ssc.gov.in. Aspirants appearing for the exam will be required to download their admit cards once they are issued. The hall tickets are uploaded on the official SSC portal. Candidates can download them by following the steps given below. Step 1: Visit the official SSC website: ssc.gov.in Step 2: Click on the SSC JE 2025 Paper 1 admit card link on the homepage Step 3: Enter your login credentials on the new page Step 4: Submit the details to view your admit card Step 5: Download the hall ticket and verify the information The SSC JE examination pattern includes two computer-based objective papers – Paper 1 and Paper 2. Paper 1 comprises 200 questions for 200 marks, covering General Intelligence & Reasoning, General Awareness. Paper 1 will be conducted in computer-based mode with a duration of two hours. The question paper will carry 200 marks and will be divided into three sections – General Intelligence & Reasoning, General Awareness and General Engineering. Candidates must attempt the General Engineering section (Part A/Part B/Part C) as per the stream (Civil, Mechanical or Electrical) they selected in their online application form. title: IIT-Kharagpur 2023 vs 2024 BTech placement trends, outlook for 2025: Top companies, sectors and more
content: IIT Kharagpur’s placement cycle for the years 2023, 2024, and the ongoing 2025 drive comes at a time when the institute’s leadership is publicly pushing for a shift in how students view their future careers. Speaking to The Indian Express recently, Director Prof Suman Chakraborty underlined that IIT graduates must “transform their viewpoint from being job seekers to being job creators” , stressing that the institute wants its students to look beyond conventional recruitment cycles and align themselves with broader innovation-led opportunities. Against this backdrop, IIT Kharagpur’s placement trends for 2023 and 2024 and the eventual outlook for 2025 reflect strong recruiter turnout, rising offer volumes, and continued interest from global technology, analytics, semiconductor, finance, and product companies. According to official data cited by media reports, IIT Kharagpur has seen steady growth in total offers over these three years, with major multinational firms, high-paying tech employers, and core engineering companies maintaining a significant presence in the recruitment process. The ongoing 2025 Phase 1 placement, as per reports, also indicates sustained demand for BTech graduates across specialisations. The 2025 placement drive, which began on December 1, 2024, has already crossed 1,800 offers, according to official data reported in the media. This indicates a healthy start compared to previous cycles. The highest package during this phase has touched Rs 2.14 crore per annum, offered by a global technology firm, continuing the institute’s trend of receiving crore-plus offers almost every year. Across undergraduate programmes, around 1,085 students have already been placed in the initial weeks of the drive. While the final average and sector-wise breakdown for BTech is yet to be released, the BTech median salary is expected to align closely with the previous year’s Rs 19.76 lakh, based on the institute’s NIRF disclosures. title: December School Holidays 2025: Full list of state-wise holidays when schools and colleges remain closed
content: School Holidays List in December 2025: The month of December marks a transition point in India’s seasonal and academic calendar. While the peak of the major pan-Indian festive season has typically passed, the month features significant regional events and celebrations across the country, including the Hornbill Festival in Nagaland, the Feast of St. Francis Xavier in Goa, the Rann Utsav in Gujarat, as well as Christmas and New Year festivities. Academically, December is an important time, often marking the season for term-end examinations in schools, and for senior classes, the beginning of pre-board exam season. With the winter season now setting in across many parts of the country, here is an overview of when schools, colleges, and other educational institutes typically observe their scheduled winter breaks and closures in the month of December. In Uttar Pradesh, schools are scheduled to remain shut from December 20 to December 31, forming the main winter break for students. This period typically provides around 10–12 days of vacation, covering both Christmas and New Year’s Eve. Similarly, in states such as Madhya Pradesh, many government, private, and centrally affiliated schools begin their winter or Christmas break from December 23 or 24, extending until December 31 or, in some cases, the first week of January. Christmas Eve on December 24 is not a universal holiday but is often observed in regions with Christian-majority populations or in schools that follow specific cultural calendars. This softer closure then leads into December 25, Christmas Day, which is a national holiday across all educational institutions in the country. Nagaland hosts the Hornbill Festival in the first week of December, drawing significant participation from schools through cultural showcases and educational visits. Goa marks the Feast of St. Francis Xavier in early December, a major religious observance that can lead to localised school holidays. In Gujarat, the Rann Utsav continues th

title: SSC gives last chance to Delhi Police, CAPF exam aspirants for self slot selection
content: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has announced a one-time chance for candidates who missed the self-slot selection facility for the Sub-Inspector and CAPF Exam 2025 to choose their preferred city via the feedback module. The SSC CPO 2025 slot selection window will remain open until 11 am on December 4. Candidates can submit their choices for the Delhi Police Exam 2025 through the official website, ssc.gov.in. According to the commission, this option is available only to those who did not use the self-slotting facility before the November 21 deadline. City allocation for such candidates will be made on a “best effort basis, mentions the official notification. The Commission has clarified that candidates who fail to utilise the one-time slot selection opportunity will not be permitted to appear for the computer-based exam, and their admit cards will not be issued. Meanwhile, the SSC CPO city slip 2025 has already been released for those who exercised the self-slotting option during the original window. The SSC CPO 2025 examination, scheduled from December 9 to 12, aims to fill 5,308 vacancies and will be conducted in four stages: Paper 1, the Physical Standard or Endurance Test (PST/PET), Paper 2, and the Detailed Medical Examination (DME). Meanwhile, the Commission released the tentative vacancy list for the Multi-Tasking Staff (MTS Non-Technical) and Havaldar posts in CBIC and CBN for the 2025 recruitment cycle . As many as 7,948 vacancies across various states and Union Territories have been announced. The figures, updated as of November 27, 2025, give insights into region-wise and category-wise distribution. According to the data, the SSC MTS under the 18 to 25 years category accounts for a major share of positions, with 6,078 vacancies, while the MTS under the 18 to 27 years category includes 732 vacancies. title: CAT 2025 Exam Analysis: Difficulty level, section-wise review, last year comparison
content: CAT 2025 Exam Paper Analysis: The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Kozhikode has wrapped up the Common Admission Test 2025. The test was held in three slots. Slot one commenced at 8:30 am and concluded at 10:30 am. Subsequently, slot two began at 12:30 pm and went on till 2:30 pm; slot three began at 3:30 pm and concluded at 5:30 pm. Also Read | CAT exam application fees rise 31% since 2021 As reported by the conducting body, approximately 2.58 lakh candidates appeared for the exam out of 2.95 lakh registered, eligible candidates. The overall attendance was approximately 86 per cent. CAT 2025 Live Updates : Slot 1 vs. slot 2, which was more difficult? Initial student reactions from test centres suggest that the CAT 2025 Slot 1 paper that was “manageable but slightly more difficult” than last year’s Slot 1. This year’s test comprises 66 questions across Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension (VARC), Data Interpretation & Logical Reasoning (DILR), and Quantitative Ability (QA). As per the marking scheme, candidates will receive three marks for each correct answer, lose one mark for every incorrect answer, and face no penalty for questions not-attempted. According to Gautam Puri, Co-founder and MD of Career Launcher, CAT 2025 Slot 1 had a total of 68 questions to be attempted in 120 minutes, with the overall paper described as “quite tricky” and more difficult than last year. While VARC and QA were broadly at par with last year’s CAT, DILR saw a slight jump in difficulty. A comparative snapshot of the exam pattern was also shared by Ramnath Kanakadandi, Senior Course Director at T.I.M.E., who noted that there were no major pattern or question-type surprises this year, and the total number of questions remained the same as last year’s CAT. Section-wise breakup as analysed by Kanakadandi – According to Puri, the VARC section in Slot 1 was similar to last year’s CAT, containing 24 questions (4 TITA and 20 MCQs) to be done in 40 minutes. Passages were dense but quest

title: JEE Main 2026: NTA begins form correction facility; know what changes are allowed?
content: NTA JEE Main 2026 Form Correction: The National Testing Agency (NTA) will start the JEE Main 2026 form correction facility soon. The window will enable candidates to update and edit certain sections of the JEE Main 2026 application . The JEE Main 2026 application form correction facility will be enabled between December 1 and 2 to rectify any mistakes in the form. The form correction window will be activated on the official website, jeemain.nta.nic.in. Read | After sharp slump in 2023-24, IIT placements improve, still below 2021-22 mark To make changes, JEE Main aspirants must access the official website, open the JEE Main 2026 login portal, and sign in using their application number and password. During the JEE Main 2026 application correction facility, candidates are allowed to modify certain details in their application form. Information that can be changed includes the candidate’s name, father’s name, or mother’s name, educational qualification details of Class 10 and 12, state code of eligibility, date of birth, gender, category, sub-category/PwD status, signature, choice of paper, examination city selection (based on permanent or present address), and medium of examination (based on permanent or present address). However, some details cannot be altered during the correction process. These include the candidate’s mobile number, email address, present or permanent address, emergency contact details, and the uploaded photograph of the candidate During the JEE Main 2026 application correction window, candidates can make changes to their application form by following a few simple steps. Step 1: First, visit the official website at jeemain.nta.nic.in and click on the “Registered Candidate Login” link. Step 2: Then, log in using your application number along with your password or date of birth. Step 3: Once logged in, the application form will appear on the screen. Step 4: Candidates should carefully select the specific details they wish to modify, make the necessary

title: Meghalaya CM releases Rs 130-crore scholarship for 70,000 students
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K. Sangma announced the release of the second and final instalment of the Umbrella Post Matric Scholarship , amounting to ₹130 crore, for nearly 70,000 students for the 2024-25 academic year on Friday. The event took place at the district auditorium and was attended by Education Minister Lakhmen Rymbui, Commissioner and Secretary of Education Vijay Kumar Mantri, West Garo Hills Deputy Commissioner Vibhor Aggarwal, and Director of Higher and Technical Education Hazel D. B. Sangma. During his address, Sangma explained that the state government is releasing the full scholarship amount using its own resources, as it has not yet received funds from the central government. He emphasised that the decision to provide the funds in advance was made to alleviate difficulties faced by students. Previously, rules prevented the advance transfer of scholarships; however, the state has now established a mechanism with the central government to facilitate earlier disbursement. Once the Rs 130 crore is transferred to the Meghalaya Rural Bank, processing and account verification will take a few days before students receive their funds. He urged students to ensure their bank accounts are linked to Aadhaar. Sangma reiterated that education remains a top priority for the government. He announced that reforms to address long-standing issues faced by ad hoc and SSA teachers are nearing completion and could be implemented in the next financial year. The program also included participation from thousands of students virtually joining from 200 locations across the state. Sangma took this opportunity to outline the government’s long-term vision, which features youth-focused initiatives such as CM Elevate, YESS Meghalaya, PRIME, MGMP, STAR, and Hello Meghalaya. “Entrepreneurship and skilling of the youth is critical for the state’s growth story,” he said. He said the government had planned economic growth not just for the coming years but till 2047, with policies

title: Assam Assembly passes 6 education bills amid opposition walkout
content: The Assam Assembly on Saturday approved six education-related bills, even as opposition members staged a walkout. They alleged that ruling party legislators entered the House after the Speaker ordered the doors closed during voting on their proposed amendments. With no opposition present, the Assembly cleared four key bills: the Assam Non-governmental Educational Institutions (Regulation of Fees) (Amendment) Bill, 2025; the Assam Education (Provincialisation of Teachers and Re-organisation of Educational Institutions) (Amendment) Bill, 2025; the Assam Elementary and Secondary School Teachers (Regulation of Posting and Transfer) (Amendment) Bill, 2025; and the Assam Education (Provincialisation of Services of Non-teaching Staff of Venture Educational Institutions) (Amendment) Bill, 2025. In addition, two other bills—the Azim Premji University Bill, 2025, and the North Eastern Regional Institute of Management (NERIM) University Bill, 2025—both introduced by Education Minister Ranoj Pegu, were passed by voice vote on the final day of the Winter Session. After more than four hours of debate on the four bills introduced by Education Minister Ranoj Pegu, members of the Congress, CPI(M), and Independent MLA Akhil Gogoi expressed discontent that none of their proposed amendments had been accepted by the government. Leader of Opposition Debabrata Saikia of the Congress pressed for a vote on the amendments, a demand supported by CPI(M) legislator Manoranjan Talukdar and the Independent member. As Speaker Biswajit Daimary moved forward with the process of passing the bills, Saikia declared that the opposition would not withdraw its amendments. In response, Daimary ordered all doors of the House to be shut immediately, preventing any MLA from entering or leaving during the proceedings. However, the opposition benches alleged that about 10 ruling BJP legislators entered the House even after the Speaker’s order. The treasury benches, however, refuted the charge. As the Speaker ma

title: Life in an IIT | From watching roads crumble to researching how to rebuild them
content: — Aijaz Maqbool Thoker Growing up in Arampora Ichigam, a small village in the Budgam district of Jammu and Kashmir, about 20 km from Srinagar, my world was simple but full of curiosity. My early schooling happened in my hometown, where I developed a strong inclination toward science and problem-solving. My mother is a homemaker, my father runs a small business, and one of the most influential people in my life has been my uncle, a teacher who shaped my academic habits and discipline from a young age. From childhood, I was driven by one constant observation – the deplorable condition of road infrastructure in my region. I often wondered why the roads were so bad and how things could be improved. This curiosity gradually turned into a focused interest in civil engineering. Today, I am 24 years old and currently undertaking my PhD with the IIT Madras-Deakin Research Academy. I am in the Civil Engineering department at IIT Madras , in my second year of the Joint PhD programme, working on the topic – ‘An effective framework for the extraction and utilisation of recycled materials in road infrastructure’. I will soon be heading to Deakin University, Australia. After finishing my basic schooling in my village, I pursued a BTech in Civil Engineering at NIT Srinagar . I stayed active in projects, technical events and independent learning during my BTech years, but the real shift in my academic direction came when I joined IIT Madras for a research internship. That experience deepened my interest in research. I later returned to IIT Madras for my BTech project, which helped me clearly understand my strengths and long-term goals. The real push towards research came during my internship at IIT Madras under the guidance of Dr Bibhuti Bhushan Bhardwaj (then PhD scholar, now assistant professor) and my mentor Prof Surender Singh. Their support made me see research as a meaningful path to solving real problems. I applied to other IITs and received offers as well, but once I discove

title: CAT 2025 Exam Analysis Highlights: IIM Kozhikode concludes exam; check slot-wise difficulty levels
content: CAT 2025 Exam Live Highlights: The Indian Institute of Management Kozhikode ( IIM Kozhikode ) conducted the Common Admission Test (CAT 2025) on Sunday, November 30, 2025. The test was held in three slots. Slot one commenced at 8:30 am and concluded at 10:30 am. Subsequently, slot two began at 12:30 pm and went on till 2:30 pm; slot three began at 3:30 pm and concluded at 5:30 pm. CAT 2025 Exam Analysis As reported by the conducting body, approximately 2.58 lakh candidates appeared for the exam out of 2.95 lakh registered, eligible candidates. The overall attendance was approximately 86 per cent. The results are tentatively expected in the first week of January 2026. This year, the examination will be conducted across approximately 170 cities, and candidates have the opportunity to choose up to five preferred cities while selecting their test centres. CAT 2025 serves as an entrance gateway for admission to postgraduate as well as fellow/doctoral programmes offered by the Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) and other participating institutions. CAT 2025: Do’s and don’ts for the exam day For more updates on CAT 2025, check the IE Education portal . The CAT 2025 exam will be held in three sessions across designated centres nationwide. The two-hour test will be evaluating candidates across Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension (VARC), Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning (DILR), and Quantitative Ability (QA). About 2.95 lakh candidates have registered for CAT 2025 . Across Slot 1, Slot 2, and Slot 3, CAT 2025 maintained a moderately difficult profile, slightly tougher than CAT 2024. VARC remained relatively consistent and accessible, but DILR and QA stood out as the most challenging sections. Preliminary calculations indicate that scoring 25–27 net correct in Slot 3 may place a candidate around the 99 percentile mark. The QA section in Slot 3 was widely regarded as the most challenging across all three slots of CAT 2025. With 22 questions and a heavier focus o

title: Bihar Board Class 10th, 12th Exam Datesheet 2026: BSEB to conduct Inter, Matric exams in February
content: The Bihar School Examination Board ( BSEB ) on Saturday released the detailed annual exam calendar for 2026, covering schedules for the Intermediate (Class 12), Matric (Class 10), DElEd, Vocational courses and various departmental examinations. The calendar also specifies exam dates, application periods, dummy card and admit card release timelines, as well as result declaration windows. According to the BSEB Class 10 datesheet , the Madhyamik (Matric) Annual Examination 2026, which will begin on February 17 and continue till February 25. The calendar also lists vocational and skill-based subjects for Class 10 students. The first shift will be held from 9:30 am to 12:45 pm (with 15 15-minute cool-off time), while the second shift will run from 2 pm to 5:15 pm. T he Class 10 practical and internal assessments will be conducted in January 2026, ahead of the theory papers. The Intermediate Annual Examination 2026 will be conducted from February 2 to February 13, 2026, in two shifts. The practical examinations for BSEB Class 12 students will also be conducted in January 2026. The detailed subject-wise timetable for both streams — Science, Commerce, and Arts — will be uploaded on the official website of the Bihar Board . Students are advised to download the official datesheet once it is made available on the board’s website. The timetable will include subject codes, examination timings, and other important instructions. Schools are expected to share the final timetable and guidelines with students as soon as they receive official communication from the board. Candidates are also advised to keep checking the Bihar Board’s official website regularly for updates or any possible changes in the exam schedule.   The BSEB Class 12 exams last year were held from February 1 to February 15 at 1,677 centres across Bihar.  Last year, 12,92,313 students appeared for the BSEB Class 12 exams , which were conducted at 1,677 centres across Bihar. Among them, 6,41,847 were girls and 6,50,

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Schools in Puducherry closed, Pondicherry Central University postpones exams
content: Puducherry Home and Education Minister A Namassivayam announced a holiday for all schools and colleges, including private institutions, in the four regions of Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe, and Yanam on Saturday. The decision was taken in view of the heavy rainfall expected under cyclone Ditwah’s influence. The name ‘Ditwah’, meaning a lagoon, was suggested by Yemen and is likely derived from Detwah Lagoon on the northwest coast of Socotra. Meanwhile, the Pondicherry Central University has announced that all exams scheduled to be held on Saturday have been postponed and a holiday has been declared for all classes at the university because of Cyclone Ditwah which is heading towards the union territory coast. A release from the Registrar of the University on Friday night said that the postponement of examinations and also cancellation of classes were due to a communication received from the Coast Guard about the cyclone and the heavy rains. A revised date of the examinations would be announced in course of time, the release said. Puducherry Lt Governor K Kailashnathan on Friday held an emergency meeting with officials, directing them to take all precautionary measures ahead of heavy rains in the union territory under the influence of cyclone Ditwah. A release from Raj Nivas said the IMD has issued a ‘red alert’ for Puducherry, forecasting intense rainfall on November 29 and 30 due to the cyclone in the Bay of Bengal. A ‘red alert’ indicates heavy-to-extremely heavy rain of over 20 cm in 24 hours. The cyclone is located about 300 km south-southeast of Karaikal, 410 km south-southeast of Puducherry and 510 km south-southeast of Chennai , the bulletin from the India Meteorological Department said. Kailashnathan reviewed the measures already taken by departments, including Revenue and Disaster Management, to tackle the expected impact. He instructed officials from disaster management-related departments to implement preventive measures. Officials informed him that personnel

title: IIM-Indore PGP 2026-28 admission criteria released; raises weightage for Class 12th marks, PI performance
content: The Indian Institute of Management Indore ( IIM Indore ) has released the admission criteria for its flagship two-year postgraduate programme (PGP) for the 2026-28 batch. The institute will follow a three-stage selection process based on CAT 2025 scores – academic performance in Classes 10 and 12, work experience, and performance in the personal interview (PI). As per the policy, candidates must appear for CAT 2025 and meet the minimum sectional and overall percentile cut-offs to be eligible for consideration. For candidates belonging to the General and EWS categories, the minimum overall cut-off has been set at 90 percentile, with 80 percentile required in each section. For NC-OBC candidates, the overall cut-off is 80 percentile, while SC, ST, and PwD candidates will require 60, 45 and 45 percentile, respectively to be considered qualified. At the shortlisting stage, IIM Indore has continued its heavy emphasis on Class 12 performance, which carries a 25 per cent weightage, compared to 10 per cent for Class 10. CAT sectional scores together account for 55 per cent weightage in the composite score used for shortlisting. Work experience carries a small weightage of three per cent, while the diversity factor adds another seven marks. Candidates shortlisted for the interview will be informed in January 2026. Interviews will be conducted in offline mode across seven cities – Bengaluru , Chennai , Delhi , Hyderabad , Indore, Kolkata , and Mumbai . The interview may also be held online depending on circumstances, an IIM Indore statement said. For the final selection, the personal interview becomes the single most significant component, carrying 45 per cent weightage in the final composite score. CAT sectional scores together contribute 40 per cent, while Class 10 and 12 marks carry five per cent each. A diversity factor of five marks is also included at this stage. IIM Indore has emphasised that merely meeting eligibility or cut-offs does not guarantee a call. Candidates m

title: Delhi schools upload nursery admission criteria for 2026-27; distance emerges as top factor
content: As private schools in Delhi began releasing their criteria for nursery admissions for the 2026-27 academic year on Friday, distance has emerged as the most weighted factor, with some schools assigning as high as 80 points out of 100. Indraprastha International School in Dwarka has allotted 55 points to applicants living within 0-12 km of the school, followed by 45 points for those residing 12-15 km away and 35 points for distance beyond 15 km. It has also assigned 15 points each for sibling, alumni and staff ward categories. For children living within a 4-km radius or in areas covered by school transport, Tagore International School in East of Kailash has given 50 points. Under the “status of the child” category, the school has allotted 30 points for first-born children and 20 for second-born, along with 10 points each for siblings, alumni and staff wards. Principal of ITL International School in Dwarka, Sudha Acharya, said their parameters will also focus on distance, sibling preference, alumni connection and staff wards. “Proximity remains the most practical factor for us, and giving weightage to siblings and alumni helps strengthen long-term family associations with the school,” she said. Among other schools, Darbari Lal DAV Model School in Pitampura has given the highest known weightage to distance, marking 80 points for applicants living within 0–2 km, 70 points for 2–5 km and 60 points for 5–8 km. Sibling and alumni categories carry 10 points. Similarly, New Green Field School in Alaknanda has allotted 60 points for distance, 10 for siblings, and 15 each for parent alumni and girl child or first-born male child categories. Amity International School in Saket has assigned 30 points for neighbourhood or distance, 20 for siblings and staff wards and 30 for alumni. The Directorate of Education (DoE) has notified the full admission schedule, with application forms available from December 4 and the first list of selected candidates to be released on January 23.
